intro: Lucuma jenmanii, commonly known as the golden star lucuma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Andean highlands of South America, particularly Peru and Ecuador. The plant produces yellow-orange fruits that are rich in nutrients and have a sweet, nutty flavor. Its leaves are evergreen and leathery, adapted to the cool, high-altitude environments it inhabits. Lucuma jenmanii is valued not only for its edible fruits but also for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
